definition: to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion
catastrophism/the theory that geological change is caused by catastrophic events such as the Biblical flood
catastrophism (theory that geological changes are brought about by catastrophes such as the biblical flood)

sentences.english: Even as a kid, I had nightmares of nuclear apocalypse.
sentences.chinese: 即便當我還是個孩子的時候，我會做核災變的噩夢。

sentences.english: YiLin is used for divination and the author is good at saying calamity and abnormal phenomena.
sentences.chinese: 《易林》原爲占筮之作，其作者本長於災變之說。

sentences.english: After the cataclysms bugs will be in abundance, as dead tissue from both plants and animals is everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 災變後動植物組織到處都是，因此昆蟲會很多。

sentences.english: An approach of adapting rocky desertification convulsion ethnic culture should be taken into account.
sentences.chinese: 應將救治思路取準於能適應災變區的民族文化。

sentences.english: And he saves people, averts catastrophe, stops bad guys from doing bad things.
sentences.chinese: 而且他救人於水火，逆轉大災變，制止壞人壞事。

sentences.english: The ecological recovery of rocky desertification convulsion areas is recognized as a key problem by the academia.
sentences.chinese: 石漠化災變區的生態恢復是學術界公認的頭等難題。

sentences.english: This hi-axial displacement will lead to semiotic disasters and cultural damages.
sentences.chinese: 這種雙軸位移將導致符號的災變和文化大劫。

sentences.english: The Well imploded, triggering the Great Sundering.
sentences.chinese: 永恆之井內爆，直接造成了大災變。

sentences.english: The Well imploded triggering the Great Sundering.
sentences.chinese: 永恆之井內爆，直接造成了大災變。

definition: interregional/spanning two or more PRC provinces
lit. large smelting furnace/fig. the mixing of different ethnicities and cultures/Melting Pot
lit. to attend to one thing and lose sight of another (idiom)/fig. to be unable to manage two or more things at once/cannot pay attention to one thing without neglecting the other
to turn a deaf ear to (idiom); to pretend not to hear
